      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Criterion Accounts.filter(String value)
      This operation will ask the backend to do a case-insensitive matching query on all viewable attributes in all the resources in the Collection.

    • Uses of Criterion in com.stormpath.sdk.query

      Methods in com.stormpath.sdk.query that return Criterion 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Criterion StringExpressionFactory.containsIgnoreCase(String value)
      Returns a new case-insensitive like expression indicating the specified value should be contained anywhere in the property value.
      Criterion StringExpressionFactory.endsWithIgnoreCase(String value)
      Returns a new case-insensitive like expression indicating that the specified value should match the end of the property value.
      Criterion EqualsExpressionFactory.eq(Object value)
      Returns a new equals expression reflecting a resource property name and the specified value.
      Criterion StringExpressionFactory.eqIgnoreCase(String value)
      Returns a new case-insensitive equals expression indicating the specified value should match the property value.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.equals(Date date)
      Returns a new expression indicating the specified date must be equal to the property value.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.gt(Date date)
      Returns a new expression indicating the property value must be greater than the specified date.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.gte(Date date)
      Returns a new expression indicating the property value must be greater than or equal to the specified date.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.in(Date begin, Date end)
      Returns a new expression indicating the property value must belong to the range specified by the begin and dates Using "in" is equivalent to gte(begin).lt(end) where begin time is inclusive and end time is exclusive.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.in(Date begin, Duration duration)
      This is a convenience method used to calculate the end timestamp for the range based on the begin date and the specified Duration
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.lt(Date date)
      Returns a new expression indicating the property value must be less than the specified date.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.lte(Date date)
      Returns a new expression indicating the specified date must be greater than or equal to the property value.
      Criterion DateExpressionFactory.matches(String value)
      Convenience method that returns a new equals expression as a String expression, indicating the specified value should match the property value.
      Criterion StringExpressionFactory.startsWithIgnoreCase(String value)
      Returns a new case-insensitive like expression indicating the specified value should match the beginning of the property value.
      Methods in com.stormpath.sdk.query with parameters of type Criterion 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T Criteria.add(Criterion c)
      Adds a Criterion to the total set of criteria (conditions), further restricting how the query executes.
      T Criteria.and(Criterion c)
      Adds an 'and' condition (a conjunction) to the total set of criteria (conditions), further restricting how the query executes.
